item.title: [SPR-2143] <aop:aspectj-autoproxy /> with abstract beans causes NPE
item.description:
When adding Spring/AspectJ AOP support (<aop:aspectj-autoproxy />), a NPE is encountered during application context intialization; the exception below is from 2.0M4, has also been reported (http://forum.springframework.org/showthread.php?p=65005#post65005) with 2.0M5.

A simple test case illustrates the issue:

Works:
<aop:aspectj-autoproxy />

<bean id="testAspect" class="bridges.web.legacy.TestAspect"/>

<bean id="testAction" class="org.apache.struts.action.Action"/>

...fails when an abstract bean is added:
<aop:aspectj-autoproxy />

<bean id="testAspect" class="bridges.web.legacy.TestAspect"/>

<bean id="testAction" class="org.apache.struts.action.Action"/>

<bean id="testAbstract" abstract="true"/>

Stack trace:

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Thanks for pointing this out - fixed! This is an issue in AspectJAutoProxyCreator's use of BeanFactory.getType for an abstract bean definition, expecting a bean class specified there - best fixed in AbstractBeanFactory's getType impl itself.

Juergen

It looks like this is only partially resolved; the previously failing test case now works, however the below test case fails with the included stack trace. Note the addition of the 'class' attribute on the final abstract bean 'testAbstract2'

<aop:aspectj-autoproxy />

<bean id="testAspect" class="bridges.web.legacy.TestAspect" />

<bean id="testAction" class="org.apache.struts.action.Action" />

<bean id="testAbstract" abstract="true" />

<bean id="testAbstract2" class="org.springframework.aop.framework.ProxyFactoryBean" abstract="true"/>
